intro: Sagotia racemosa var. genuina, commonly known as the Hawaiian mountain ginger, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant features strap-like, dark green leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. Its inflorescence consists of clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas on the island of Hawaii.
